articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Sony (6758.T) must face a mass lawsuit worth up to 6.3 billion pounds ($7.9 billion) over claims the PlayStation maker abused its dominant position leading to unfair prices for customers, a London tribunal ruled on Tuesday.
articles.title: Sony facing $7.9 billion mass lawsuit over PlayStation Store prices

articles.author: Chris Prentice, David Lawder, Jonathan Stempel
articles.description: The deal, which will see Zhao personally pay $50 million, was described by prosecutors as one of the largest corporate penalties in U.S. history. It is another blow to the crypto industry that has been beset by investigations and comes on the heels of the recent fraud conviction of FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried.
articles.title: Binance's Zhao pleads guilty, steps down to settle US illicit finance probe

articles.author: Chavi Mehta, Max Cherney, Stephen Nellis
articles.description: Chip designer Nvidia (NVDA.O) said on Tuesday it expects a steep drop in fourth-quarter sales in China - a key revenue generator - in the wake of new U.S. rules, but forecast overall revenue above Wall Street targets as supply-chain issues ease.
articles.title: Nvidia outlook beats expectations but China worries linger

articles.author: Ahmad Ghaddar
articles.description: An OPEC technical panel invited a top financial market dealer to give a presentation this week which painted a bearish outlook for the oil market, according to materials from the presentation seen by Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: OPEC hears bearish message on oil from top swap dealer's presentation

articles.author: Casey Hall, Jenny Wang
articles.description: A top Alibaba executive told staff on Wednesday that it was a "coincidence" that a plan by former chief Jack Ma's family trust to sell some shares in firm was disclosed on the same day the firm scrapped its cloud unit's listing.
articles.title: Alibaba exec moves to quell staff concern over Jack Ma share sale with internal post

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Antoine Arnault, one of LVMH (LVMH.PA) Chairman and CEO Bernard Arnault's five children and heirs, will step back from the day-to-day management of upscale menswear label Berluti in January, kicking off a management reshuffle at several labels in the group.
articles.title: LVMH heir Antoine Arnault to step back from Berluti management role

articles.author: Christoph Steitz, Tom Käckenhoff
articles.description: Germany's Thyssenkrupp (TKAG.DE) on Wednesday unveiled a 2.1 billion euro ($2.3 billion) impairment on its steel unit due to a "gloomy" outlook, highlighting the challenge in efforts to win Czech energy group EPH as a co-owner for the business.
articles.title: Thyssenkrupp posts $2.3 bln impairment on steel division

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Maayan Lubell
articles.description: Israel's government met into the early hours of Wednesday to consider a deal for Palestinian Hamas militants to free some hostages in Gaza in exchange for a multi-day truce and the release of a greater number of Palestinian prisoners in Israel.
articles.title: Israeli government debates deal for release of Gaza hostages, truce

articles.author: Jeffrey Dastin
articles.description: OpenAI on Tuesday said it reached an agreement for Sam Altman to return as CEO days after his ouster, capping frenzied discussions about the future of the startup at the center of the artificial intelligence boom.
articles.title: OpenAI restores Sam Altman as CEO after his tumultuous ouster

articles.author: Asif Shahzad
articles.description: Pakistan's Supreme Court accepted on Wednesday a bail application from detained former Prime Minister Imran Khan, his lawyer said, a day after another court declared illegal his trial on charges of leaking state secrets.
articles.title: Pakistan's top court accepts Imran Khan's plea for bail
